content:
What a great way to reconnect! Finding old friends on Facebook can be a wonderful way to rekindle relationships and share memories. Here are some tips to help your mom find her old college friends on Facebook:

**1. Use the "Find Friends" Feature**:
	* Click on the "Find Friends" button on the top right corner of the Facebook homepage.
	* Enter your mom's college name, graduation year, and other relevant information to find friends from her alma mater.

**2. Search by Name**:
	* Type the person's name in the search bar at the top of the Facebook page.
	* If the person has a common name, try adding their maiden name, initials, or a nickname to narrow down the search.

**3. Use Facebook Groups**:
	* Search for Facebook Groups related to your mom's college or university (e.g., "University of [College Name] Alumni" or "[College Name] Class of [Year]").
	* Join the group and browse through the member list to find familiar names.
	* Post a message in the group asking if anyone knows the whereabouts of her old friends.

**4. Check Alumni Associations**:
	* Look up your mom's college alumni association website or social media pages.
	* Many alumni associations have directories or online communities where members can connect with each other.

**5. Ask Mutual Friends**:
	* Reach out to mutual friends from college who are already on Facebook and ask if they're connected with your mom's old friends.
	* Ask them to introduce your mom to their friends or share their contact information (with permission, of course).

**6. Check Old Yearbooks or Photos**:
	* Dig out old college yearbooks or photo albums to find names and faces to search for on Facebook.

**7. Be Patient and Persistent**:
	* It may take some time to find the right people, so be patient and don't give up!
	* Encourage your mom to reach out to people she finds and reintroduce herself, sharing a brief message about how she found them and what she's been up to.

Remember to respect people's privacy and boundaries when reaching out to old friends. It's essential to be considerate of others' decisions to reconnect or not. Good luck, and I hope your mom is able to reconnect with some wonderful old friends!
